item.title: Accelerate: The best book I read in 2020
item.description: The book I wish to introduce to you today is titled Accelerate ⏩, from authors Nicole Forsgren, Jez Humble & Gene Kim . This post isn’t a review — it is a short summary of my opinions and insights gained upon reading this book. I’d highly recommend it for anyone who is writing any kind of software(I absolutely mean it 😄). How often do we get started with writing code caring very little about deployment in the beginning — to realise that we should have thought about it from the start(even if that’s for rapid prototyping).

item.title: About
item.description: Hi there 👋, thanks for stopping by! I’m Harsha. Software Engineer by profession — interested in all things Data Science, Distributed Systems and Computer Graphics. Apart from that, I enjoy travelling 🚅, cycling 🚴‍♂️ and reading 📚. For most of my career, I’ve worked in the Visual FX and Post production industry 🍿. Super proud to be working in the studio that made the Gravitational renderer for the movie Interstellar.
